articles.description: Hey, good morning! You look fabulous. Good morning! Do you remember Magic Leap? You might remember the hype. Well, we now have a headset to stare at -- even if it's just a render. Your old iPhone is also slow for a reason and there's talk of a YouTube rival f…

articles.description: A Health and Human Services hackathon produced smart ideas for the fight against opioid addiction—but can only do so much in the face of a collapsing health care system.
articles.title: Tech Alone Can't Solve the Opioid Crisis
articles.author: Issie Lapowsky

articles.description: With polls suggesting that the public favors net neutrality rules, Democrats are poised to make the recent repeal of the rules an issue in 2018 campaigns.
articles.title: Why Net Neutrality Will Be a Campaign Issue in 2018
articles.author: Klint Finley

articles.description: The specter that is America’s opioid crisis claimed a record high number of lives—more than 40,000—this past year, a new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has found. And the collective destruction of the epidemic has helped lower the …
articles.title: The Opioid Crisis Has Again Shortened US Life Expectancy
articles.author: Ed Cara

articles.description: Justin Huang helps a client sign up for a health insurance program under the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare, at the offices of the Midwest Asian Health Association in the Chinatown neighborhood in Chicago last week.
articles.title: Fact Check: Trump Falsely Claims to Have ‘Repealed Obamacare’
articles.author: LINDA QIU

articles.description: Kelley Mui helped a client sign up for the Affordable Care Act in Chicago last week. The number of people who signed up through the federal marketplace was only slightly lower than last year despite a shorter enrollment time.
articles.title: Obamacare Sign-ups at High Levels Despite Trump Saying It’s ‘Imploding’
articles.author: ROBERT PEAR

articles.description: Passage of President Trump’s “beautiful” tax cuts will give Republicans a victory to talk about, but they still have to contend with an unpopular president.
articles.title: Tax Cuts Buoy Republicans, but They’re Swimming Against an Undertow
articles.author: JONATHAN MARTIN

articles.description: A group of Rohingya refugees walked to the mainland of Bangladesh earlier this year. Maung Maung Soe is the first high-level Burmese military official to named in sanctions, who is sited for the continuing deadly crackdown on the Rohingya.
articles.title: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on 52 People and Entities for Abuse and Corruption
articles.author: GARDINER HARRIS

articles.description: Election workers in Hampton, Va., recounted ballots in a Virginia House of Delegates race on Tuesday, delivering a one-vote victory for the Democratic challenger. On Wednesday, judges declared the race a tie.
articles.title: A One-Vote Victory in Virginia Lasts One Day as Judges Declare a Tie
articles.author: TRIP GABRIEL

articles.description: President Trump got the go-ahead to build that wall. No, not that one — the one on the coast of his County Clare golf course in Ireland. The "wall" is actually two walls along the country's Western coast, running more than 2,000 feet on one side and 550 feet …
articles.title: Trump's Irish golf course gets approval to build that wall, thanks to climate change
articles.author: Sasha Lekach

articles.description: Donald Trump is obsessed with size and saying "Merry Christmas," so it's only fitting he'd combine his two loves to send out a stupidly large Christmas card. To celebrate the holiday season, Trump sent Congress a card — which seems like a normal, friendly thi…
articles.title: Of course Trump's Christmas card is obnoxiously large
articles.author: Nicole Gallucci

articles.description: Welp, the Republicans passed their tax plan through Congress on Wednesday, which includes huge tax cuts for the wealthy and corporations. The middle class? In a decade, they'll actually see higher taxes. All that's left is for President Donald Trump to sign t…
articles.title: Seth Meyers takes down the Republican tax plan
articles.author: Keith Wagstaff

articles.description: Let's be honest here, 2017 has had nothing but disappointments and mediocrity. This tumultuous year has taken such a toll on us that the only thing that made us smile, even a little bit, was our dear old friend and the best place for great memes: Twitter. Sur…
articles.title: 50 best tweets that helped us cope throughout 2017
articles.author: Leah Collie

articles.description: Republicans from the Senate and House posed with President Trump on Wednesday at the White House after the passage of a tax overhaul. “House Democrats want a SHUTDOWN for the holidays in order to distract from the very popular, just passed, Tax Cuts,” Mr. Tru…
articles.title: With a Friday Deadline, G.O.P. Lawmakers Rush to Avoid a Government Shutdown
